result.execSummary:
All charges against Alfredo Apolonio Perez-Goplen in this case have been dismissed. These charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Alfredo Apolonio Perez-Goplen is presumed innocent.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Alfredo Apolonio Perez-Goplen

records.addlTxt: 11:33 AM DA Karl Kelz calls case and states appearances. Defendant Alfredo Apolonio Perez-Goplen appeared, in custody, in the courtroom.  Karl J. Kelz appeared for the State of Wisconsin. DA Kelz states DE handed him a document from MN department of corrections. DA asks the Deputy to contact Sheriff department and verify warrant. Off Record. Back on record 11:40 AM, appearances are the same. DA Kelz states he has documentation showing no active warrant in system at this time. State requests dismissal. So ordered. DE requests pay to stay at jail be waived. Court comments. Adj. 11:43 AM.

1:15 PM DA calls case and states appearances and possible charges. Defendant appeared via video from Price County Jail. Karl J. Kelz appeared for The State of Wisconsin. DA Kelz presents the court with a copy of the Minnesota warrant the defendant is currently being held on. Court recites warrant on record. Court questions defendant in regards to the warrant. DA Kelz requests "no Bond" at this timeand states an extradition hearing has been set for 04/18/2022 at 11:00 AM. DA Kelz requests the defendant be in person from the jail at the hearing Monday. Court orders defendant is held in Price County Jail w/no Bond until the extradition hearing. Clerk provides the defendant a copy of the MN warrant per his request.
